NO

The provided code does not violate the ERC-20 rule that requires emitting an "Approval" event when the `approve` function is called. Although the `approve` function itself does not directly emit the event, it calls the `_approve` internal function which, according to the comments, is responsible for emitting the "Approval" event. The actual emission of the event is not shown in the provided code snippet, but the comment in the `_approve` function clearly states "Emits an {Approval} event." This indicates that the implementation is intended to comply with the ERC-20 standard by emitting the event within the `_approve` function.
